mediacapture-streams/GUM-deny.https.html.comment: FF and Safari can't be automated to deny permission, but works on manual testing

mediacapture-streams/MediaDevices-getUse.comment: resizeMode not implement in FF (#1433480) or Safari

mediacapture-streams/MediaDevices-after-.comment: Cr's 1st failure is issuing a wrong error code; 2nd test failing in Cr and SF is linked to promise timing, with limited interop impact

mediacapture-streams/MediaDevices-enumer.comment: only Cr implements Permissions-Policy header, but it doesn't apply the enumerateDevice algo implications; FF & Safari don't implement header but do it right with the allow attribute
only Cr implements Permissions-Policy header, but it doesn't apply the enumerateDevice algo implications; FF & Safari don't implement header but do it right with the allow attribute
InputDeviceInfo missing in FF; FF exposes deviceId before capture; Chrome uses 'default' instead of empty string but that's acceptable

mediacapture-streams/MediaDevices-getSup.comment: resizeMode, sampleRate, sampleSize, latency not implemented in FF and SF; aspectRatio not implemented in FF

mediacapture-streams/MediaStream-MediaEl.comment: Cr and SF don't follow mediastream reading rules - that said, they're more HTML's than gUM's

mediacapture-streams/MediaStream-support.comment: FF and Sf don't implement permissions policy header yet, but iframe version works

mediacapture-streams/MediaStreamTrack-ap.comment: resizeMode not supported in FF / SF - marking OK since not specific to applyConstraints

mediacapture-streams/MediaStreamTrack-ge.comment: FF doesn't implement getCapabilities() nor InputDeviceInfo; SF failures come from lack of support for sampleSize, autoGainControl, noiseSuppression, latency, channelCount, groupId, resizeMode

mediacapture-streams/idlharness.https.wi.comment: FF misses getcapabilities, OverConstrainedError; Cr & SF implements an old version of OverconstrainedError IDL ; FF is missing InputDeviceInfo

mediacapture-streams/MediaStream-removet.comment: Cr doesn't end media elements correctly on removeTrack; SF doesn't end audio element correctly

mediacapture-streams/MediaStreamTrack-ge.comment: SF doesn't implement groupId (?), FF doesn't expose deviceId of stopped tracks, and SF & FF don't implement sampleRate, sampleSize, latency, aspectRatio, resizeMode

mediacapture-streams/MediaStream-MediaEl.comment: Not clear where the fact that no suspend events get fired comes from

mediacapture-streams/MediaDevices-enumer.comment: deviceIds aren't rotated by clear-site-data, but it isn't crystal clear that they should (yet)
Chrome list all devices in enumerateDevices prior to access to camera; FF exposes deviceId before capture
Cr return 'default' as id of its pre-permission object; Firefox exposes deviceId before capture

mediacapture-streams/overconstrained_err.comment: FF & Safari don't implement OverConstrainedError as a distinct interface, but they do signal the relevant errors for constraints they support
